1.content:
“Repeat that again,” you barely manage to say. There must be a mistake, you reassure yourself, there’s no way what she’s telling you is the truth. You probably misheard her in the first place and are getting worked up for nothing. The doctor’s office seems to shift and bend as you look at your doctor. Everything seems to slow down for you when you see her look apologetically at you and repeat what she’d just said.

“I’m sorry, you’re dying.” You’re no longer able to look her in the eyes as it hits you full force, you are dying. You feel sick and want nothing more then to run away, find a dark spot and curl up in shock. But you stay. Mostly because of the other news she gave you after announcing your imminent death. You know you must have misheard that because it was ludicrous, completely impossible.

Your doctor is going through some papers, trying to find the best way to tell you the other bad news about how your going to die. There are so many ways to die in this world, disease, accident, murder, but the reason you’re going to die is the most outlandish reason you’re ever heard. It can’t be the reason for your death because simply put, it can’t physically happen. “There’s no mistake I’m afraid,” the doctor sighs and puts down her papers, “in less then a week you’ll shrink down to nothing. Becoming so small, an atom could crush you.”

“How?…Why?” You ask as you grip with the notion of shrinking. It’s not too hard to completely imagine because you’re already losing height. You came in this morning to talk with your doctor about losing a few inches of height, thinking that you were probably imagining the problem. After a series of grueling tests and waiting for nearly ten hours, your doctor comes back to tell you you’ll continue to shrink until there’s nothing left.

“We’re not sure about either, you’re case is a medical marvel. We’ve never seen anything quite like it before in the history of medicine. The blood samples we took shrunk as we were looking at them under a microscope, which none of us can figure out. We aren’t sure why you’re shrinking, but if it continues at the rate it’s going, you’ll be lucky to still be alive by the end of the week.” She’s actually smiling as she tells you this. To her, your death will be a medical mystery that hundreds of research essays will be written about and millions of dollars will be spent studying, but to you, it means only one thing, you are dead. Slumping forward, you try not to cry, but a few tears escape you. None of this is fair, you don’t smoke or drink or have any diseases. You’ve never even been sick before. Why were you dying? The answer wasn’t going to matter, you were dying and no force in the world could change that. You’d be dead soon and as insane as it sounded, a certain freedom came from that fact. You had no future, only a right now, so what were you going to do?

You look at the doctor as she babbles on and on about studying you before you shrink to nothing. One thing was for sure, you aren’t going to spend your last days being poked and prodded by scientists. You had already been told there wasn’t a cure, so there was no point in staying any longer. You get up to leave and the doctor tries to stop you. Her concerns are brushed off and you look at her with a tiny sad smile. “I need to go,” you whisper and leave the room to your doctor’s protests. She wants to study you, learn as much as she can, but you won’t let her. Every second matters right now and you have to live every second you have left to it’s fullest. Life is short for you and it’s only going to get shorter because as the doctor had been talking, you had lost another inch. Soon it would be feet, then more, until you disappeared. Nothing left to do now, but enjoy every second you had left before you faced your shrunken demise.

You tease and make anyone less popular then you miserable and you’ve never regretted it, until now. Are you Sarah Klamert, popular and dwindling school girl?

David Cooper, age thirty-nine
You’re a quiet man, handsome, but far too shy. With short brown hair, baby blue eyes and a chiseled physique, not many people would believe that you’re withdrawn. You’ve always had a happy, satisfying life even though you are a bit bashful. You have a surprising effect charm on the ladies that makes you very popular, but you’ve never let it go to your head. Also having a calm mind and peaceful soul has led you to be considered a great guy, which doesn’t sit well with some of the more jealous people in your life. You remain oblivious to anything wrong in your life and enjoy everything around you to the fullest. You’ve lived without taking many chances, but will this change now that your days are numbered? Death can change a person drastically; a wallflower can become a part animal. You might just find that shy, withdrawn man disappearing as you shrink. Are you David Cooper, inhibited and peaceful young man?

Martha Baker, age thirty-nine
It's a man's world, but that hasn't stopped you from trying to rule it. You're a bright stock broker that is worth millions, who has worked herself up from humble beginnings to become one of the most powerful women in the city. Your success has all come from your cold hearted, cut throat business practices. You take no prisoners and accept nothing but number one. You've stepped on many people to get where you are and no doubt they're all celebrating at the news of your pending death. The person that takes the full force of your cruelty is your assistant Hannah. Poor girl only wants to make a living, but you make every day of work hell for her. You are sexually active, but your relationship's never last. You like to be in control and when you grow bored of men you toss them away. Your a bonafide man eater and have everything you want, which only makes you tiny fate all that more devastating. Are you Martha Baker, cut-throat bitch?

Or are you someone else? Someone not created yet...

Dying sucks, probably more then being a sixteen-year-old boy. Behind you, your parents are talking loudly with one another, trying to come to grips with something you already have. They were with you when you went to see the doctor, listening in shock to every word she said. Your mother had cried, your father had shouted, and you had sat there numbly, trying to imagine shrinking until there was nothing left. You had gone through all the phases of acceptance and had come out refreshed and accepted the fact that you were going to die. You’re parents though were stuck on several different stages.

“I’ll sue the quacks that run this place! I’ll sue the government for not telling us this could happen! I’ll sue science for letting this happen!” You distance yourself from your father as he gets louder and louder about whom he is going to sue. He’s stuck on anger, unable to let go of his irrational rage against a disease that no one’s ever heard of. You’re dad has always been a passionate guy, big, burly and very active. Apparently, he had considered playing professional football in his younger years, but a bad leg injury had kept him from going pro. You’ve always looked up to him and now that you’re several inches shorter, you really do have to look up to see him. Right now, you only wish he would stop screaming, people are staring. You find it a waste of energy to blame someone for the things no one can control. Time could be better spent enjoying the life you had left rather then getting angry.

“My poor baby! He had such a bright future! He could have been a doctor, or a scientist or the president of the United States of America!” You want to get away from your crying mother, but she has wrapped you in a tight hug and is not letting you go. She’s stuck on grief, crying loudly and trying to stay as close to you as possible in fear of inevitably losing you. All you can do it pat her on the back and tell her everything going to be fine, which in truth it isn’t. You’re mom has always been there for you, she gave up a career to raise you and your sibling. As a stay at home mom, she’s been there for you through thick and thin, and you love her for that. You let her bury her face in your shoulder and cry, rubbing her back as she wails.

At the age of sixteen, you are going to die, tragic of course, but at least you’ll be surrounded by your family. You have regrets of coarse, you’ll never get to tell the head cheerleader at your school that you love her and get laughed at for being a dweeb. You’ll never graduate high school and go to college. Most of all, you regret that you’ll never lose your virginity. Kind of a stupid thing to worry about when your on deaths door, but you always wanted to know what it felt like to make love with a woman. It’s what all teenage boys dream of, having sex with a hot girl. Now it’s too late, you’ll never lose your virginity because soon you won’t be able to look a woman in the eyes without a step ladder. Now that was tragic.

The thought of how your going to die wanders through your mind. Shrinking down sounds kind of cool honestly, if you ignore the fact that you’ll continue to shrink until a speck of dirt becomes the size of the Empire State building. You could do so many cool things shrunken down, like peek into the girl’s locker room or look up look up skirts. Right now, all you can focus on are the perverted purposes of being small, but who can blame you? Hormones rage inside you, demanding you go nuts now that your times up. However, you have no clue on how to quell these raging feelings.

You look between your crying and screaming parents, wanting to get away from all the drama before you break down. You’re only holding it together out of the fact that you don’t have enough time left to feel sorry for yourself. You got to enjoy these last few days as much as you can.

You let your parents go one a while longer. Your father rants and raves, your mother cries hysterically, latching onto you arm. You just sigh. You appreciate their concern for you, but you're losing the precious time you have left. In a few days who knows how small you'll be. Will you have lost a foot? Two? Will you be able to fit into the palm of someone's hand? Will you be microscopic?

The concept of shrinking is so unreal to you. It just doesn't seem feasible. But you don't want to go and get a second opinion, only to be poked, prodded, and given the same diagnosis. Deep in your gut you know it for truth, and you've accepted it. Now you just want to get home asap. The minutes are ticking away and there's so much you want to do. There will be time to spend with your family when you're tiny, incapable of caring for yourself or traversing your home. Now was really your last chance to spend time with friends and family.

"Mom, dad, lets just go home." you finally interject.

"Anything you want baby, anything you want." Your mother sobs. Your father is still threatening to sue anyone and everyone, including other patients and family members currently in the waiting room. Eventually he calms down enough to stop hollering at the top of his lungs, but he's still fuming mad. The three of you head out to the car, your mom clutching you as if you're a life preserver.

Dr. Augustine comes running out to the car, hollering for you to wait and causing a scene. She clearly wants to examine you and take more samples, but you aren't willing to be her guinea pig, even if it might help people in the future who contract the illness. Your dad drives off, nearly hitting her, but she's quick to step out of the way.

At home you head inside and spend the next few hours with your family. Your sister is at soccer practice so she isn't here to hear the news. She'll find out soon enough. You collapse on the couch, closing your eyes, while your mother goes to make a 'special' dinner, and your father gets on the phone in an attempt to track down a 'real doctor'.

Resting on the couch, you wonder what you should do.

1111.content:
It’s obvious that your not going anywhere, your mom’s making a ‘special’ dinner for you, your sisters about to come home and you really don’t want to face any of your friends with the grim news. No, what you want right now is to stay home, spend time with your family and try to go out with dignity. Holding onto your dignity may be a little hard because your clothes are getting baggy very quickly. Your shirt used to be a little tight on your chest, but now it looked like you’re wearing a shirt two sizes to big. It’s really a bummer to know you’ll look like a midget in over sized clothes before you die.

The front door opens and you hear someone stomping into the living room. You turn to see your sister standing there, wearing her soccer uniform and gaping at you. “What happened?” She almost screams at seeing you nearly half a foot shorter. Your parents come running in when they hear your sister scream. Dad goes over to your sister to calm her down, while your mother hangs back to give you support. You kind of wish she’d give you some room, ever since coming from the doctor she’s either been smothering you with affection or trying to make you as happy as possible. It’s not that you don’t appreciate her, it’s just you wish she wouldn’t hug you so tightly to her bosom so much. You might soon be shrinking to the size of a baby, but that didn’t mean you wanted to be breast fed.

Looking back to your sister, you see her talking quickly to your dad about what is happening. You zone out, not needing to hear the details of your death sentence again. Instead, you think about your sister and the relationship you have with her. Calling your sister your friends is a little bit of an overstatement. There is no hate between you either, just a healthy sibling rivalry. You’re the older brother by two years, making her fourteen going on fifteen. Your reluctant to admit it, but your sister can be best described as a future babe. Right now, she’s just incredibly cute with freckles, curly brown hair, big blue eyes and a slim figure that was budding quickly into adulthood. She had finished with her training bra last year and had worked her way from an A to a C since. Because of her maturing body, she has been wearing reveling clothes to school that are quickly making her very popular with the boys.

Her personality matches her body, sweet with a hint of something dirtier. To most people she could be the most adorable person in the world, but she thrives on attention and loved for those around her to look upon her at all times. It was her controlling attitude that caused most of your arguments. She wanted to be in charge of you, but you always fought back. That might be harder now that you’re shrunken down to her size.

“Oh my God, is it true bro?” Your sister says and rushes towards you. For the first time ever, your eye to eye with your little sister, something you know she’d have once loved to take advantage of, but right now that was the furthest thought from her mind. Smiling sadly at her, you nod once to answer her. Before you know what’s going on, your sister embraces you in a huge hug, wrapping her arms around your back tightly. You hug her back, happy that she’s dropped any sibling rivalry in your time of need.

“Thanks, I really needed that. But could you put me down? I don’t need you lifting me up to remind me off how small I am.” You tell your sister and pat her on the back several times to tell her to let go. She looks at you, not breaking the hug, with a confused look on her face. “I didn’t pick you up.”

“What are you talking about, my feet are hanging in the air?” You laugh at whatever joke your sister is playing on you, not finding it funny at all. You look into your sister’s face noticing that it seems bigger then it did a moment ago. Behind you, your mother gasps in shock. Getting scared fast, you look to see that your sisters arms grow wider around you quickly, seeming to expand a few centimeters every second. It hits you why your feet are dangling, your shrinking in your sisters embrace. Your not the only one that notices, your sisters cries out in surprise and drops you. For what should be a foot feels a lot longer as you hit the floor hard. Everything starts to black out. You’re passing out, either because of the fall or because of the steady rate of shrinking. The last thing you hear is your father screaming to your sister.

“Quick, Jessica, get a damp cloth. Your brother’s passing…” You miss the rest because the blackness envelopes your world and you go into a deep sleep. Hopefully, when you wake up, you won’t be batting away dust bunnies the size of tumble weeds. So much for keeping your dignity, you’re heading towards Small Town fast and then Microscopevile, before reaching the land of Nothing.

11111.content:
Faces hover over you. They’re all distorted and shaky, and you wonder what’s wrong with them, but the problems not with them, it’s with you. Blinking several times to readjust your eyes, the faces start to come into focus and you see they belong to your family, your big family. Checking yourself over, you see that your pants and shoes are lying in front of you as your shirt drapes over your body. Your father stares nervously at you, finally speaking up because no one else will.

“Easy there, son. You took a huge fall and then…um…” You know what your dad’s trying to say. It’s not like you can miss the fact that your family's heads are three times bigger then you remember. You’d shrunk again, this time losing over a foot of height. Your family wasn’t giants yet, more like Amazons. “How small am I now?” You ask someone, needing to hear the answer. You weren’t sure if you were three feet tall or only a foot. It may seem pointless because eventually you’ll be smaller then even that, but you still need to know. This times it’s your sister who speaks up.

“No one’s measured you since you started shrinking, but if I had to guess, I’d say you’re roughly two and a half feet tall,” Jessica estimates after taking a good look at you. The number rolls around in your head, two and a half feet. It’s better then a foot, you guess with a sigh. Without warning, two huge hands grab you by the armpits and lift you high into the air. Your legs kick helplessly in the air as your lifted seemingly over twenty feet up. You scream out as your sister lifts you higher to look at her little big brother. She marvels at your small size, never thinking she’d ever see anyone this size in her life.

“You know, as freaky as it sounds, you’re kind of cute this size,” Jessica giggles and brings you closer to her body to cradle you in her arms. You squirm as she brings a finger down to your stomach and tickles you playfully. You try to push her finger away, but she’d too big. Your sister messes with you, forgetting about your coming death momentarily as she has a blast teasing her once bigger sibling.

“Honey, put down your brother. He might be incredibly cute at this size, but he’s scared,” Your mother interjects, hiding a smile behind her hand as your sister pinches your little cheeks. You glare across the room at your mother, you aren’t scared and you certainly aren’t cute. Your sister finally puts you back down on your feet, swatting you in the butt out for just pure entertainment. You glare at her, thinking how upset she’ll be later when you’re gone and all she’ll remember is embarrassing you in front of everyone. Jessica giggles loudly, not showing any signs of feeling bad at all, no matter your prediction.

“It’s gets late,” your mother sighs and looks at the clock. “It’s nearly midnight and I’m sure everyone is tired. You’ve got school tomorrow and I don’t want to get another letter from your teacher about you falling asleep in class.” Jessica opens her mouth to complain and probably bring up your impending downsize as reason to stay up later. One glare from your mom is enough to shut her up though and she’s left only to sulk. You turn to go upstairs to your own room to sleep, wondering how you’ll get any shut eye with your condition, when your mother stops you.

“Hold it right there, you are not sleeping in your room tonight. What if something happens and you need help, but are too small to get us. No son of mine is sleeping alone when he’s shrinking away.” Groaning loudly, you wish you had seen this coming. You’re over protective parents are going to babysit you even while you sleep. So much for getting some privacy tonight. Jessica hears your mom and smiles softly. Either she’s happy that your going to be looked after like an infant or is hoping that your parents will ask her to babysit you tonight.

She'd stared at you expectantly and, though you didn't give her a peck on the cheek, you'd given her a great big hug that had sent her running and giggling after you released her.

So though you weren't exactly her friend, you always felt that she'd liked you. As of right now though, you can't help but be absolutely terrified. Your illness, which you were expecting to progress at a constant rate, had suddenly kicked into hyper drive reducing you to a size smaller than a Barbie. Oh no, you'd been smart enough to leave your house without knowing the full nature of your affliction, and without informing your parents where you're going. For all they know you're upstairs in your room, or you'd ditched them to head over to a friend's house. Your brilliant lack of concern and foresight would cost you. No one would ever guess you were in the hands of a small, awkward, ginger girl from across the street. In other words, you were at her complete and utter mercy. Unsure of her plans for you, you cross your fingers (or you would if they weren't cupping your genitalia) and pray Beatrice has good intentions.

After going in through the side door Beatrice makes sure the coast is clear, then bolts up the stairs to her room. You arrive at a door with a multicolored sign taped to it. It issues a warning to trespassers reading, 'Welcome to Beatrice's room, enter without knocking and you're lunch!' Weird, but then again, Beatrice isn't your average girl. Entering her room she quickly locks the door behind her. Why her parents would ever allow her to have a lock for her door is beyond you. Looking around your new habitat, you take in the strange sights.

Carelessly strewn about papers and clothing little the floor. Here and there you see an odd object or two among the clutter. Some play jewelry, a fake light saber, a plastic brontosaurus, among other oddities, catch your eye. It seems she actually has a computer in her room, set on a desk with a trippy looking lava lamp. There's a dart board attached to the back of her door, a replica of a human skeleton is propped up in one corner of her room, and she has a table with a model volcano on it, perhaps a science experiment for school.


Beatrice jumps up onto her bed. Kicking off her flip flops and quickly plopping down on her butt, she sets you in between her legs. Wiggling toes, she gives you a wide grin, exposing her braces, "So, what do you think of my room?"

"It's....... nice?" You respond slowly.

You decide to try reasoning with her again, "Look Beatrice, if you haven't noticed, there's something seriously wrong with me. I need help, and I need it right now. Please take me home."

"Yeah, but did you know the real reason he's dying," another of her friends asked, "I heard it's some kind of weird disease that makes you shrink until youre nothing!"
"WHAT?!" Cassie shouted, "Youre kidding! Really, Sue?"

"For real, Cass!" apparently Sue replied, "they say that when you got this disease, your body actually gets smaller and smaller every single until finally POOF! There's nothing left of you!" Hearing that almost made you let out heavy sigh, but you held it in for obvious reasons.

"God, that's like some weirdo sci-fi shit going on!" the other friend replied.
"You think that's weird?" Sue remarked, "I remember my cousin telling me about this one friend he knew that had that same disease, but he found out some sort of way to stop the shrinking... but by then he was only about two inches tall."

...That last part snapped you out of depressive state and opened your ears! Some guy found out a way to stop the shrinking?! How come your doctor didnt know about it?! You need to hear this!! You dont know whether Sue's joking or not, but youre desperate.

*Sniff sniff sniff!* Just then, you felt a bit of sniffing come from just inches away from your body. You turned your head and jumped back at what you saw!
"A-" you cover your mouth to block your scream. It seems you failed to notice Cassie's leashed big little black chihuahua with big hazel eyes staring directly into your soul.

It's hard to decipher that stare he's giving you. He's either just eyeing you stupidly or glaring at you as if to say 'The hell do you think youre doing?!' Whatever the reason, you do not want to spook this dog. If it barks, your covers blown and you'll probably die MUCH sooner than expected!

You sway your hands away and mouth 'SHOO! SHOO! GO AWAY!' But it just tilts it's head and stares at curiously.

In an instant, Cassie's hand came down toward you to pick you off the ground. Unsure of what to expect, you closed your eyes and awaited your fate. Hopefully, it wont be too horrible. And if it is, well at least you can safely say that you left this world living your life to the fullest!

"Poor guy. He must be REALLY desperate. But can you blame him?" you heard Cassie's voice comment. Good! It looks like they can overlook your little perverted moment because they feel sorry for you. See? Dying DOES have it's advantages.

You finally open your eyes to see Cassie's face staring inches away from you in concern. Normally this would spook the hell out of you, but a lovely face like this? Rosy cheeks, slight freckles, sky blue eyes, lucious pink lips, golden blonde hair (just about as blonde as her *COUGH!*)
If think is in any way what Heaven will be like, youre more than ready to die! But then again, if that chihuahua glaring up at you is in any way what Hell will be like, maybe youre not!

"Awww... how cute!" you turned your head to the girl who's name wasnt mentioned yet. Her skin was lighter toned than Cassie and the shape around her sky blue eyes told you she was of oriental nationality. It was difficult to determine what nationality by the pink streaks in her long black hair and her pink backpack with a picture of an anime-style rabbit and big white words in Japanese stitched onto it!

Heh, if you could, you'd probably choose to hide in Cassie's shirt just in between those soft and ROOMY breasteses of hers. THAT would be a good hiding spot! But you'd rather not press your luck!

Just moments of being all alone in that big scary backpack made you realize how scary your situation really is. Not only are you dying, but now youre a little homesick. As if you werent already feeling scared shiteless, you saw a big note aside of the blades... you couldnt understand it cuz it was written in Japanese (DUH!), however at the very bottom it was signed.... in blood.

According to your view, you find yourself in a window-side of a 2-seated row near the back of the bus, no sign of Cassie and Sue in sight. The backpack itself took up one seat and just next to you was Akane lying by her lonesome just inches away from your tiny body atop Mt. Pinkie!
Luckily, she didnt notice you. She was too busy looking through a newspaper. You recognized a certain article with a picture of you, a picture of your family, and a picture of the doctor who declared you untreatable.

And noticing that huge tattoo of a big black serpent wrapped around her neck didnt help soften the situation either! How the hell did you miss seeing THAT? Because you were too busy staring at OTHER parts of her, perhaps?!

Anyways, the tattoo was the very last piece that gave it away! The blades, the contract signed in blood, the creepy voice on the phone, the tattoo on her tattoo and the possibility that she might have other tattoos hidden on her body... they all lead to one big conclusion: Yakuza!

Y...YAKUZA?! SHE'S IN THE JAPANESE MAFIA?! THEN WHAT THE BLOODY HELL ARE YOU STILL DOING AROUND HER?! DONT YOU KNOW WHAT'S GONNA HAPPEN TO YOU WHEN SHE FINDS OUT THAT YOU KNOW HER SECRET?!!! YOU GOTTA RUN! RUN FAST!! RUN NOW!! WHY ARE YOU STILL READING THIS?! GET THE FUCK OFF THAT BACKPACK AND HIGHTAIL IT,BEFORE-

"MAWINSKI-SAN?!" you overheard Akane say your last name somewhere in the middle of that Japanese sentence! Unfortunately, you said that out loud! Akane's eyes widened as she turned her head to you. "P...[Peter]?!" she seemed to assume her cutesy innocent, "...A..Are you alright? What's wrong?"

115.content:
The next couple days were spent in deep contemplation, or at least that’s what you told your parents as you stayed home from school and played video games. Life had kind of moved to a standstill for you as you waited to shrink to nothing. You hadn’t told your friends, unwilling to explain your bizarre medical condition to them. The whole idea of spending time with your family wasn’t happening as when they weren’t working they were calling up doctors and medical experts for some kind of miracle cure, which you considered was a waste of time. They had never been another case like yours in history, it wasn’t an epidemic, and so no one was rushing to find a cure. You were happy to stay right at home and wait for your fate, no reason to get over emotional.

A knock to your door woke you from your afternoon nap and you turned to see your mom walking. If she was hear to take you for more experiments you would tell her to forget it, but she wanted you to do something much worse.

“Peter, I’ve been talking with your father and we think you need to talk to someone about what you’re going through. I know how hard this is and you need someone to help you out of this terrible depression.”

“I’m not depressed,” you tell her. Sure, you weren’t exactly happy with your current situation, but you weren’t crying yourself to sleep or rocking back and forth denying what was happening. All things considered, you thought you were doing pretty well for yourself. Of course, what you felt didn’t matter when your mom thought differently.

“I know you’re just being strong for me and your father, but you need help dealing with all your pain. That’s why you’re going to see a specialist in helping you deal with the emotional problems you’re having.”

Mom! I’m not going to see some shrink!”

“She’s a psychiatrist, honey,” Your mother reassures you, but it doesn’t matter, she thinks you are having problems dealing with the situation and now she’s sending you to see someone that’s going to make you sit on her couch and talk about your dreams. You have nothing against psychiatrist, you sure as hell think your parents would be well suited to talk to one, but you don’t need this or want it. You’re happy with the way things are and don’t need to talk through anything that’s going on. You certainly don’t want to tell people about your condition, the less people that know the better in your mind. You're not so much embarrassed by it as you are worried about being seen as a freak.

“I’m not going and that’s final,” you tell your mom and cross your arms over your chest. You know you’re acting childish, but you can’t help it. You’ll let doctors poke and prod you, but you draw the line at this

“No video games or television then,” your mom counters, knowing how to play this game. You stare hard at her, trying to will her to change with your mind, but she stays strong. Once she gets an idea in her head no force was going to change her mind. Running your fingers through your hair, you sigh loudly and grumble, “When are we going?”

The next morning you're standing in front of a dinky looking building as your mom sits in her car behind you. “Julie... I mean Dr. Winters is on the top floor. She’s an old friend of mine from college and I think she has a degree in child psychiatry or something. I’m sure she’ll help you with all your personal demons.”

Under your breath you mutter, “The only demon I have is you.”

“What was that?”

“Nothing,” you quickly tell your mom, not wanting to piss her off. All you had to do was make it through one session and tell your parents this was pointless. You’ll be done in an hour and back home, away from prying, stupid shrinks.

“Have a good session, I’ll be back to pick you up at the end of your appointment at the end of the day. Have fun.” Before you could complain about your mom leaving you here for the entire day, she drove off, leaving you at the door of your own personal Hell. Groaning, you enter the building and head into the elevator, pushing the bottom for the top floor. You briefly consider just ditching this and taking a bus home, but that would just get you into trouble. Steadying yourself, you get off at your floor and head towards the only door you see, the one with ‘Doctor Winters’ in large, faded letters. Unenthusiastically, you knock.

“Come in.”

She sounds young, maybe in her late twenties or early thirties, can’t say for sure. At least you won’t be explaining your life to some old lady, which makes it better, kinda. Opening the door, you pause as you see Dr. Winters for the first time, your mind processing the strange, new person your mom has sent you to discus your innermost secrets.

“You must be Peter, take a seat.”

1152.content:
“Uhh,” that’s really the best sentence you can form right now. When you think “Shrink” you envision some stuffy, stuck up type in a business suit with glasses who seems to be only interested in nodding a lot without actually saying anything, or maybe someone dressed a tad more casually who tries to act like you are best friends from the moment you first walk. Dr. Winters however didn’t fit either of those descriptions at all…though you could definitely say that she dressed casually.

A very ratty looking white midriff covered such large and round breasts, and its tiny shoulder straps showed no evidence of a bra. She was also wearing jeans, but these had to be the most bizarre pair you have ever seen as when they reach the top of her thighs, big holes suddenly form, leaving equally small straps to come up and connect only to the section with the loops for her belt. These means her hips and crotch are completely exposed, covered only by a black thong and fishnet covering all of her hips.

“Something wrong?” Julie asked, already having a very good idea for the cause of your sudden silence. Fortunately, you managed to snap yourself out of it shortly after hearing her voice, and thus actually managed to look up at her face. It was quite a pretty face, all natural to, with not even a hint of makeup in sight. You’ve always had a thing for naturally good looking girls. Dr. Winters also had the biggest ponytail you had ever seen, done up in her blond hair. Really, the only flaw you notice right away is that her she's got a kind of pudgy stomach, but even that doesn't detract from her beauty. Finishing your admiring, you finally answered her “Uh, no. Thanks,” and made your way over to the couch.

As you take your seat, you realize just how much less you knew to do right now. Dr. Winter’s very appearance had shattered your expectations. Who knew Psychiatrists could dress this way? Trying to get some semblance of normalcy back, you said this “So um, you went to college with my mom?”

“We had a couple of classes together. I let her copy my answers, and other days I’d copy hers, it was a beneficial arrangement.” She answered, cracking a little smile. That actually got a very brief chuckle out of you, and all of a sudden, you felt kind of good about being here…for about three seconds. Julie put a stop to all that with just one question, “So, how are you feeling?”

“Oh boy, here it comes.” You groaned inside your head. Running your hands down your cheek, you pushed aside your frustration to at least answer the doctor “Look, my mom probably told you I was in a real bad place emotionally, right?” She nodded in response “Yeah, plus I also looked up what’s been happening to you. I can’t say I’m surprised; something like this would get anybody depressed.”

“But I’m not depressed.” You tell her, already sure she’ll spit out the next clichÃ© “Denial is always the first stage.” Before she could though, you kept talking “Look, I know what’s going to happen to me, but I’m not sad. There’s not fighting what’s happening to me, so why should I get upset over it. Everybody dies at some point. Sure, I was hoping my time would come sooner than later, but if there’s nothing that can be done to save me, then that’s that. All I want to do is enjoy the time I have left, not waste it by moping around like a moron.”

“So, you don’t even feel a little sad?” that’s what Doctor Winters asked you, now making you wonder how exactly you just screwed yourself. Did that make you sound emotionally unstable or more like a cold robot with no emotions? You could already count how many more meds or sessions she was going to prescribe, but before that, you at least answered her question “A little, sure, but like I said, why should I dwell on it?”

Taking another look at you, Julie then scribbled something else down on her notepad. You fought down such a strong urge to groan in frustration, but that was when caught you by surprise “I don’t look like a psychiatrist, do I?” She took your sudden jump as her que to smirk again, and keep talking “To tell you the truth, I used to be a social worker.”

“Why?” you asked, not sure why someone apparently her kind of education experience would get a career like that. “I don’t know. When I graduated, I just felt this weird compulsion to help out anybody less fortunate or just a couple dollars away from being homeless. It was alright, but after a while, it didn’t feel like I was doing enough. Fortunately, that’s when my degree came in handy.”

“Smart move.” You responded, finding yourself feeling a little better about being here. It was kind of hard to put your finger on, but something about Julie was making you feel, well, kinda good, which all and all was a lot better than feeling indifferent.

“Well, I’m smart enough to see that there’s nothing wrong you.” That definitely got your spirits up, and then you saw Julie just toss away her notepad. Kicking her shoes off, this odd but very smart psychiatrist told you “So, I’m guessing your ride’s not coming back any time soon. What do you want to talk about?”

"Well, why can'tcha?" Em adjusted her glasses, looking confused, "I mean, you're not going anywhere, are you?"

"Well no, but..." Izz hesitated, really wanting her parents to come home soon, so she could get this weight off of her chest. However, her sister's comically huge eyes continued to stare at her, this time looking concerned.

"Something's wrong, isn't there?"

"Whaat? Noo..." Izz averted her gaze and breaking out into another snide chuckle, "Wh-what makes you think-"

"Oh gosh, there is!" Emily gasped, already breaking out into tears, "I-I thought something was weird the moment you got home! Y-you didn't call me anything nasty, a-and you wanted to play video games, and-"

"Alright, quit it!" Izz yelled, silencing her sister almost instantly, "I didn't tell you cause I wanted to tell the parents first, alright?!"

"B-but you've been holding that in all this time, and I couldn't help in some way?" tears began streaming from the fourteen year old's eyes, "D-do you need anything? Do you need blood? Organs?! I mean, I kinda like mine, b-but if you really need them, you can have them sis... I-I don't mind..."

And unable to prevent it, Izz found herself throwing her arms around her little sister, "Ohh, you silly thing, come here..."

Overwhelmed with guilt over something that should've been avoided - if only her damn parents were home - the older girl sighed, "Listen Em, I... have to tell you something."

Still sobbing gently into her shoulder, Emily mumbled a "hmm?"

____________________________________________________________________________ _________________________________________________________

"...so, long story short, I'm gonna keep shrinking til I just cease to exist." Izz explained to her ashen faced sister, "Fun, huh?"

"You... what?!" Emily shrieked, stunned beyond disbelief, "I-is that even possible?! I mean, how the hell are you just gonna 'cease to exist'?!"

"I'll eventually just... get so small that people won't notice me... I guess..."

"B-but I..." Em wailed, "Isn't there something that can be done about this?! I mean, there's gotta be a cure, right?!"

"...apparently not." Izz began shaking violently, unable to bear things any longer, "Y...y'see why I wanted... t-to tell Mom and Dad first?"

Her face screwed up, and tears finally burst from their corneal prisons, "I'm so sorry I was so mean to you, Em!"

"Ohh, it's okay Izz, don't worry about it...!" Emily tried to smile, holding her sister's head to her shoulder and stroking the girl's hair, "I've been called much worse, and - hey, what the?"

"What what?" Izz mumbled, lifting her head from Emily's shoulder, "What's wrong?"

1212.content:
“Ashley, hi,” you sniff and wipe away any tears that might be lingering in your eyes as you look at your sister. Ashley had been outside when you got home, trying to catch some bugs for her collection. The eight-year-old girl loved collecting tiny insects and keeping them on display in her room, which was another thing you found revolting about her. She’s wearing those ugly brown overalls she so loved on top of a white stained shirt. If that wasn’t bad enough, she was bare foot in the house and had left dirty foot prints on the floor. Your first reaction is to mock her about the ugly way she’s dressed, but you push down that urge, when you remember your condition. You swore to yourself that you were going to make things right with your siblings, so you might as well start with Ashley.

Putting on your happiest face, you pull up a chair at the dinning room table and gesture for Ashley to sit. She looks at you strangely, but doesn’t move. She can sense something off and doesn’t want to come closer. Sweetly you ask, “Ashley, could you come here. I want to have a big sister talk with you.” You pat the seat of the chair, urging Ashley to sit down, but she keeps her distance. You’ve never gone this long in the same room as your sister without saying an off hand insult towards her and it’s got her worried.

“You okay, sis? You’re acting a little strange, even for you.” Your smile drops at your sister’s last comment. She thinks you’re the strange one? She’s the one that likes to run around the backyard looking for bugs without any shoes. You’re the very pinnacle of normal, she’s the freak in the family. No, you can’t think like that. Happy thoughts, happy thoughts. You’re here to make peace with Ashley, not critique the way she lives.

“Is it so strange for me to want to talk to my favorite littlest sister?” You giggle, trying to reinforce the pleasant older sister image you’re trying to portray. Ashley gawks at you, not believe your fake sweetness for a second. She then shakes her head and starts to chuckle.

“Since when have I been your favorite anything? As long as I can remember you’ve been a bitch to me. So what’s with the sudden kindness? You want me to do something for you? Like maybe act as a watch out when you screw one of your boyfriends or pretend to be your happy little sister so you can impress some of your friends with your generosity. I’m out of here, I got more bugs to catch.” She turns to walk away, but you won’t let her. How dare she ignore her loving older sister like that! You rush towards her and spin her around, grabbing her shoulder tightly. Your grip will probably leave a bruise, but you don’t care. All you’re seeing is red right now as you stare down at Ashley’s scared face.

“Listen her you little freak! I’m trying to be nice to you, but you won’t let me! All I wanted to do was bury the hatched and fix our relationship, but you know what, fuck it! You’re a stupid, little brat that should have been disowned the moment you started picking your nose. Your disgusting and stupid and… and…” Your lungs tighten up and all the air leaves your body. You go stumbling back, letting go of an astonished Ashley. The room spins again, this time it won’t stop. With a thud, you collapse to your knees and fall to your side. You look up to see Ashley curiously looking at you before you black out.



When you open your eyes again, you feel better. The tightness in your chest is gone, you don’t feel dizzy or weak, everything seems to be fine. You rub your head, glad you didn’t land on it. That would have been so bad; smashing your head on the floor could have left you with a scar or a nasty bump. You can’t let your perfect face get damaged in any way, it was your best feature. You look up, expecting to see your parent’s kitchen, but instead you see something else. Ashley's face fills your vision, so incredibly huge that you can see every one of her young, but rugged features. Her eyes are the size of cars, pointing strait at you from one a few feet away. You can see yourself in her eyes, a tiny naked thing next to a pile of clothes. Ashley smiles at you, each of her baby teeth are bigger then you.

“Look who’s up. I think we will have that sister talk after all,” she giggles. Her laughter nearly blows you away, but you remain lying on the floor, frozen in fear. Every insult you’ve ever made, every verbal abuse you ever dished out, every attack you have ever done replays in your mind as your sisters looms over you like a great god about to bring down mighty vengeance upon a helpless mortal. You tremble under Ashley, knowing in your heart that your sister had no plans to help you and that things were going to get very rough, very soon.

12121.content:
Terror fills you as you stare up at the titanic eight-year-old girl. You’ve never seen anything as big and scary as this child in your whole life. Her smile glistens above you and her eyes dance with excitement. Ashley has been waiting a long time to get back at you for all the crap you’ve pulled. Now that your as small as one of the bugs she likes to catch, hundreds of different twisted ideas go through her mind. You can see the evil thoughts brewing in her big brown eyes. Willing to take a chance in your giant house, you run in the opposite direction of your sister.

Ashley watches you run for a few second, then lifts up her giant, dirty foot and takes one huge step. Her foot crashes a few inches behind you, shaking the ground and sending you falling forward onto the floor. You stare at the ground, breathing hard and scared out of your mind. Turning over to your back, the sight of your sister’s giant sole hanging over you makes you scream in horror. Ashley playfully scrunched her powerful toes above you, delighting in the way your tiny face scrunches up when you scream.

“Lets talk, sis. You’ve been keeping me under foot all my life, maybe you should know how that feels?” Ashley hisses, while anticipating the feel of your little naked body under her foot. You remain frozen, unable to look away from your sister’s huge, dirty soles. The bottom of her foot is nearly completely brown with dirt, but no amount of filth could hide their putrid smell. They were ten feet above your head, but you still gagged at the strong odor. Ashley’s foot smelled like old cheese that had been in the hot sun for hours and dried feminine sweat. The smell got stronger as slowly Ashley began to lower her foot on top of you.

You nearly wet yourself as Ashley’s foot hovers only a few feet over you, dangling dangerously over your whole body. Just as the hope of your sister stopping starts, it’s squashed as Ashley slowly starts pressing her filthy foot down on you. Immediately, you become frantic and disoriented by the strong smell and the incredible pressure on top of you. The smell was so unbelievably intense that you begin to hyperventilate and desperately punch the giant foot. Ashley is careful to apply enough force that your pined, but enough that your also being slowly smothered under her foot. She then begins to grind you softly into the linoleum floor and you start to pass out. The smell becomes too much for you, but before you completely blank out, she rolled her foot back and forced you under her toes.

Now free of the rank sole, you take a breathe, but when you open your mouth it’s filled with a thickly, slimy substance. You retch when you see it’s the glop between your sister’s toes. What you taste is Ashley’s toe jam.

Ashley doesn’t miss this and starts laughing hysterically, putting far too much pressure on you and nearly snapping your tiny rib. She lets up when she sees you turning blue in the face. Your sister looks down at you, grinning at your pea-sized head sticking out from between her toes. She squeezes her toes together, crushing your head in the process. You cry and scream, unable to deal with this humiliation or pain any longer. Ashley pretends to pity you and coos softly, “What’s wrong? You can dish it out, but can’t take it?” You want to scream back that you’ve never done anything this horrible or disgusting to her before, but she scrunches up her toes again and your head is in a vice.

“Man, this is so much fun. Who’d of ever thought that I could have so much fun with you?” Ashley howls, enjoying the tiny naked girl pressing against the bottom of her foot. Feeling bolder, she applies more pressure to hear you squeak yet again. Her foot presses down again, flattening you against the bottom of her foot. All the breath leaves your lungs and you gag violently. More tears well up in your eyes, this time from your burning lungs. You’re passing out again, this time from the ungodly pressure on top of you. A stray thought goes through your mind, dying right now under your sister’s foot might be a good thing because if you survive this, she’s going to just keep on torturing you until you’re dead.

121211.content:
The increased pressure is too much. You can't seem to get any air into your lungs. You want to shout out, to plead with her, but you don't even have the breath to do that. Your vision starts to blur and you start making strange animalistic sounds, trying desperately to call your sister off. Ashley doesn't even seem to notice. She's too busy laughing at your plight, and scrunching her toes to torture you. Everything is just too intense. The weight on your chest, the smell of her feet, the foot jam polluting your mouth. Your blurred vision turns black as you start to lose consciousness. Your last thought is how unjust your fate seems. You're the height of perfection, one of the most popular and lusted after girls in your school, and everyone loves and adores you... Except for your runty, disgusting, undisciplined sister Ashley (and four eyes Emily). And out of all the people you could have shrunk in front of, who had it been? It was so unfair. Now you were going to die, crushed to death by your 'little sister' while choking on a clod of dirt, lint, and sweat that had been stuck between her toes. Your sister's malicious giggles grow distant. Darkness and silence overtake you.

When you come to you here voices talking... They're discussing... something, but the words are too garbled and nonsensical. You sit up. You have an amazing headache and it takes a few seconds for your vision to clear. Your mouth tastes like.... well, sour milk and foot sweat. The disgusting lump that your sister had forced into your mouth is gone. A revolting revelation comes to you. You must have swallowed it. You do your best not to vomit all over the hard wood surface you're currently lying on. Eventually you get your bearings. You're sitting on a table in your families living room. Looking up you see your parents and your two sisters... All four of them are talking, and there seems to be something resting in your mother's cupped hands.

"It's a good thing you were here Ashley, I don't even want to think what might have happened to her if she'd shrunk when no one was around. We've had that roach infestation recently and-" Your mother stops and shudders, not even wanting to think about the horrible thought. Ashley just nods.

That demonic little bare foot imp! She must have lied to your parents and told them she'd found you passed out on the carpet. Wait till you told everyone the truth. You do the best to stand but a sudden wave of dizziness causes you to fall down flat on your ass.

"It's just so tragic." Your mother sniffles, "I should have sent your sister to see a doctor sooner. I had this ominous feeling in my gut, but I never could have imagined..." Your mother pauses, sinking inward a little and allowing tears to escape from her eyes. Your father puts a sturdy hand on her shoulder. Eventually she collects herself enough to continue talking, "It's so tragic... Soooo tragic. Your sister and your brother." Your mom shakes her head in dismay. Wait a second, your brother? But isn't he at college?

The brother she's referring to is 20 year old Mike, your older sibling. He's currently a junior at a state college a few hundred miles away. He's a decidedly average looking person, not someone worthy of your notice but not someone you'd go out of your way to mock. Unlike you he has always been close to your younger siblings. In fact he, in many ways, encourages and exacerbates their weird and antisocial behavior. For example, when Ashley would bring him a bug from the yard to look at he'd feign interest instead of telling her what a repulsive little freak she was. And just three weeks ago, for no particular reason, he'd bought Emily a new microscope for the miniature play lab she has in her room. Your sister Emily, already being a scrawny metal mouthed bookworm, certainly didn't need any more books or science gadgets littering her room. If he had wanted to do her a favor he should have bought her some Hollisters. Unlike you, he actually has a close relationship with your younger siblings whom are very affectionate towards him. While you'd always been distant and a little cold towards him, he'd been the easiest sibling to tolerate.

"It's all right honey, we'll somehow manage to overcome this." Your father says, wrapping his arms around your mom. She's shaking slightly, "I just don't know what to do. We were visiting your mother one moment, and then the next we're getting a call saying Mike has shrunk to a few inches in height... And then after we pick him up we come home to find that Sarah has shrunk too. *sniff* My poor babies!" Your mother buries her face into the palm of her free hand. You're finally able to make out the object in her other. Why, it's none other than your older brother Mike! He shrunk too? What the hell? Maybe there was something wrong with you and your brother genetically. If that was the case then your parents were to blame. They'd given the both of you (but more importantly you) some weird genetic mutation or recessive trait. You felt a sudden swelling of resentment but it quickly dies. They may have given... what ever it is you have to you, that didn't mean they had done it maliciously.

"There there, it'll be all right. We'll find a doctor who can help them." Your father reassures, "Who cares what that quack Sarah visited thinks?"

Your mother nods but you have the feeling she's not even listening to your father. She's too wrapped up in her own grief, "Girls." Your father says suddenly, "It's times llike these we have to come together as a family. Things will be tough but we're the Klamerts, we'll persevere. Now since Mike and daddy's little angel have shrunk," You see both Ashley and Emily cringe a little at your nickname, a reminder of their second place status in your father's heart, "we need to do our best to watch out for them. They're not going to be able to leave the house unaccompanied, and there'll have to be someone keeping an eye on them at all times. This is a big responsibility now, they're your brother and sister, can your mother and I trust you to take care of them when we're not around?"

The two girls nod. Emily extends her hand to your mom, almost eagerly. Your mom, very hesitant to let go of her now miniature first born, eventually tilts her hand. Your naked brother lands in the palm of your mutual nerdy sister, Emily. She adjusts her glasses and raises her palm to her face.

She looks down at your brother, a sad smile on her face, "I'm sorry it had to be this way, but I'm glad you're home." It's very difficult to hear, but you think you can make out your brother's words.

"Well I would have rather not shrunk, obviously." Your brother replies, "but since I have, I'm glad I'm back home with you all. There's no place I'd rather be."

"Really?" Emily asks, her smile widening as she looks at your brother with big wet eyes.

"Yeah really! We're else would I want to be besides home with my two favorite girls?" Emily giggles and her cheeks flush. Ashley rolls her eyes, she's not big on the mushy family bonding stuff, but she does shoot your older brother a smile. It's not the same twisted sneer that you received from the imp when she'd nearly crushed you beneath her stinky foot, but one of genuine affection.

"I suppose, since they can't take care of themselves, they'll have to sleep in our rooms?" Emily asks your dad.

He nods, "We can't have them alone in their rooms. What if they shrunk further in the middle of the night and we lost track of them? What if they needed help? No, we're going to have to look after them 24/7."

Emily nods, "Well, Mike can stay in my room." she says shyly.

"... Alright, but you have to be careful with him."

Ugh, the scene is disgusting. Emily takes a lot of crap, deservedly so, but your brother only ever has nice things to say to her and, in the rare instances he teases her, it's always in a playful manner that Emily is quick to reciprocate. She was very clingy and affectionate towards him. When he left for college she no longer had a defender to stand up to your bullying, and you know she missed him terribly when she started her Freshman year at your high school. Not having an overabundance of friends, she'd usually lock herself in her room and call up your brother whenever she was feeling depressed, or fed up with your metal mouth jokes. Now that he was back though, and apparently rooming with her, Emily looked positively ecstatic. You do your best to pull your eyes away from the dorky sight. Family bonding was supposed to come in small, barely tolerable doses, and it wasn't something you should actively seek out. Your sister is uncool to the extreme though, so her delighted reaction isn't surprising though. You have to wonder how much she actually grasps the situation. In a few days you and Mike will probably be the size of dust mites, good as dead. You almost smirk thinking of what her reaction will be then. She'll probably feel terribly guilty about being glad her brother came back (considering the reason he came back was because he was afflicted with a fatal illness), and of course she'd most likely feel terrible about neglecting you, her older, smarter, prettier, sister.

"Frank, I just..." Your mother presses her cheek against your father's chest.

"Girl's, I'm going to go lie your mother down. Today has been quite a shock for her. Watch your siblings for the next few hours, all right?" Your father turns and walks your mother out of the room as if she were an old woman in a nursing home.

"No wait! Mom, dad, I'm awake!" You squeak. After the way Ashley treated you, you definitely don't want to be left alone with your devilish little tomboy sister again.

Too late though, they're gone. Fortunately your two giant little sisters didn't hear your voice either. Right now they're busy looking at your brother.

You aren’t a slut or anything so vulgar, but you know that looking attractive can get a woman far in life. You get into your car and take off your shoes, which are now one size too big to fit your feet. The biggest irony is that you’ve been drinking diet shakes and running a mile every day for the last months to lose weight and now you were going to lose all the weight you wanted and then some.

Revving the car, you lay your forehead on the steering wheel and wonder what to do. There’s not many options left for you except die in a few days. Since you were little, you’ve tried to control everything, bossing those around you and manipulating your way to the top. In all honestly, you regret much you’ve done, but have always thought it was for the greater good, you’re good. You get driving, allowing the sound of traffic to take you away from your problems. Still, no matter how hard you try to not think about it, your mind keeps returning to your imminent fate. At least you wont suffer as you shrink, all the inches you’ve lost so far were not felt, you barely even noticed them. There’s always the chance that the doctor was wrong, but somehow you don’t put much on that desperate hope. You were definitely shrinking, and it showed no signs of slowing down any time soon. You have accepted that you are dwindling away, but that doesn’t mean you’re happy about it.

“Come on! Who taught you to drive?” You curse to the mini-van that pulls ahead of you. It feels good to yell at someone, even if it is only for a minor moving violation and they can’t hear you. Clenching the wheel tighter, you grin grimly at the cars around you as they refuse to move no matter how much you want them to. You’re stuck in a traffic jam, probably caused by some drunk trying to swerve. Out of pure spite, you hope their dead. Why should others live when you are going to die?

You almost laugh, in your haste to get away from your problems, you’ve been driving around, wasting the little time you have left. 144.content:
Sighing you eye the little digital clock on your car's dashboard, it said it was 3.41 P.M. In a way it was a good time to learn of your condition, almost every possible thing would be open right about now and you were still big enough that you could do those things without getting hurt of weird looks.

You could still see your fingers trembling, the news of your imminent death was just too shocking. Sure you may have been a little bitchy, hell a cut throat bitch but you didn't truly do anything to deserve such a fate as death by shrinkage. Just thinking about it brought shivers to your body, in mere days you would probably be able to be crushed beneath someone's foot, a day or two after that you would probably fight for survival from gigantic balls of lint or such, and finally at the end of the week you would either get crushed by gravity or from the weight of a single atom. Not exactly the brighest future.

But it was still early, you may have been diagnosed with more or less a death sentence but that didn't mean you just had to sit and suffer through it! Heck now you can do the things fear held you back from! Before you had any sort of adventure or pleasurable experience there was still something to be done, you would have to visit your work office.

Your time may have been short but you wouldn't just shirk off your duties, you would inform your company of your imminent fate and then name a successor to run your empire. Just leaving without saying a word is simply stupid, you worked your ass off to get the company to what it was and you'll be damned if it goes down with your death! Although it would make a lovely parting gift....

The choice was clear and you made it without hesitation, as soon as you could you would visit your business office. However the heavy traffic jam you were in came first, it'd be a miracle if you were out in a hour but chances were it would be closer to three.

The actual time was between your guesses, after about two hours traffic started to move along smoothly; which after two hours of waiting without budging an inch was like a gift from god. There was no way of telling if you had shrunken much from the wait, things seemed the same but there was no real certainty. Only way to find out was to stand up and compare yourself to someone you knew.

It seemed like only seconds passed before you arrived at the office, probably due to the waiting period you had to go through. Stepping out of your car you instinctly clicked your tongue in slight frustration, your clothes were even looser than before. The shoes you wore were probably a size too small now.

You didn't show weakness though, with a clear authoritative aura you walked into your business office. With a sudden change of the air everyone in the building turned to you, smiling nervously and offering good tidings to you. They weren't being nice, it was out of fear; the job paid well but you, their boss was very hard on them. It isn't a stretch to say that you fired people only because they annoyed you once, when you practically run the city you can get away with that.

It's been like that for ages though, at this point you ignored them all and awaited for the arrival of your assistant. Right on cue the brunnette Hannah ran around the corner towards you, wearing a clearly fake smile.

"Good morning Miss Baker!"

"It's the afternoon you idiot." You grumbled, Hannah annoyed you to no end but she had her uses; plus as an assistant she was little more than your slave. You also realized something that bothered you, Hannah was taller than you, it meant you had lost approximately a foot since this morning.

Hannah too focused on your demeanor to notice this, appeared to nearly faint, "So sorry mam! Is there anything you need."

You kept it short and sweet, "Call everyone together in the main hall, I have an announcement."

If she had any questions Hannah knew not to ask, after nervously looking you in the eye she took off back where she came from, you could hear her panicked voice screaming at everyone to get into the main hall.

In less than a minute everyone who worked for you was assembled in the main hall, you stood before the large crowd like a dictator and their army.

Not one to mess around you jumped right to the point, "I'm dying."

The reactions of the crowd varied, some laughed as if you were joking, some appeared to be thanking god, and some just seemed bewildered. You weren't sure who asked but someone raised their hand, a man and asked. " When?"

Rather rude way to ask but you elaborated, " The doctor said a week. Apparently I have some unknown disease."

"Is it contagious?" A scared worker girl asked.

Smirking you replied, "If it is I'll die happy knowing you all are burning with me."

The crowd laughed nervously, many of them showing extreme signs of anxiety. Hannah, near the front of the crowd asked another question, "What does this disease do?"

With a sigh you answered, "It sounds unreal...but it's shrinking me. Slowly I will become a foot tall, then an inch, and I'll just keep on shrinking until an atom crushes me." The crowd was silent, awestruck by your statement. It didn't matter to you in the slightest if they believed it, you just continued. "So I am naming a successor to carry on my business."

The air in the room grew heavy, every person in the room wanted this job; the power to make others miserable for a change. With authority you pointed at a brunette girl with a dark blue miniskirt and glasses, her eyes almost appeared evil, a trait you admired. "You're the only person who can keep my business empire running the way it should be, so you shall be my successor....Maria."

Maria chuckled and adjusted her glasses, "Thank you mam."

"Be sure to work them to the bone."

Maria's smile grew wider, "Trust me, the nice streak is over."

Ignoring any responses by the crowd you clapped your hands. "NOW GET BACK TO WORK!"

As quickly as it was made the crowd dispersed. Among the last to leave was Hannah, who looked heartbroken, poor naive girl seriously thought you were going to choose her. If anything you'd shrink her with you just so she can suffer too. The news seemed to have been accepted, you expected many skeptics to leap at the whole shrinking thing, but no one said a word. It was how they lasted in this job, treat your word like the word of god.

Boredly you enter your old office to gather your things.In the process of naming a successor you seemed to have also lost a few more inches, you were probably around five feet tall now. It took a while but you gather a large box full of your various belongings, heck you probably lost another few inches just doing this dull activity.

Just as you were going to carry to box out of the room a knock came from the door. You went and answered it...

The small towns that you pass by are simply at a crossroads and have names like Lancaster, Chesterton, Anderson’s Corners and a lot of other names that you forget as soon as you pass by the little town. You really don’t care where you end up; you had a full tank of gas when you decided to drive until you’re out of gas. You wander aimlessly, taking random turns down dirt roads.

You simply drive on into the night, little caring where you’ll be in the morning. To take your mind off of things, you have put on your favorite CD and sing along with old songs.
At around one o’clock in the morning, the car starts to sputter. It looks like the car has ran out of gas. You manage to pull the car off of the street and get out. You’re about six inches shorter than you were. There’s no traffic on the street at all. As you look around, you see a sign.
“Hidden Springs 1½ Mile
Gordon 10 Miles
Port Amanda 40 miles”
“Guess I’m going to Hidden Springs” you say aloud.
You begin to walk down the darkened street. There’s no streetlights here out in the boondocks, but you see some lights up ahead, no doubt belonging to the town you’re going to. As you continue to walk, you shrink down another three inches. Your about the size of a teenager now, and your clothes are starting to get a little baggy on you. You’re going to Hidden Springs because you’re tired and in need of sleep. You wonder just how small you’ll be in the morning.

Hidden Springs is bigger than those four-corner towns that you passed by earlier in the day. The population of this town must be 15,000 or there about. You see a hotel nearby and make for it. According to the hotel’s sign, there’s free HBO and Showtime. You enter the hotel’s lobby, where a lonely man of about 20 is behind the counter. The young man is watching the TV behind the counter, pointed away from you. As you get closer to the counter, you begin to feel dizzy and have a shrink spurt. Your doctor did say that you might have these shrinking spurts during the week. You were about the size of a teenager, but now you’re the size of a big toddler or small child. All of your clothes have fallen off of you and surround you like a tent. Now you can’t even see over the counter. You clear your throat loudly. In about a minute, the young man finally spots you.
“What are you doing up this late, little girl?” he asks.
“I’ll like a room and I’m not a little girl” you say sternly.
“Oh” said the man. “so we have another little person in town”
“I’ll like a room” you repeat.
“Oh, sure” said the man. “you can have Room 135, it’s just down the hall”
"Um...I might have trouble getting into the room at my size" you say, as the man gives you a keycard for the room.
"No problem" said the man.

info.brief_description: You shrink until you disappear forever, what will happen? Now with Harry Potter!
info.description:
Welcome to my new shrinking story with a twist.
Your doctor has told you that you are going to be dead soon, not from a conventional illness, but from a new shrinking disease. There’s no cure and no way to know how fast you will shrink. You’re life as you know it is over. So now what? You could lock yourself up and watch as the world grows around you until you vanish forever, but what fun is that. If you’re going to die, you’re going to go out on your own terms. Spend time with your family, put right a wrong, or just go crazy with the one you love. You’re dying so what’s the worst that can happen?


Please add to whatever you can, a few words can go a long way. Good chapters will be rewarded Gift Points as thanks for the contribution.
Anything goes in the story, keep in mind that you don’t have much time and you want to enjoy yourself before you shrink down to nothing. Sex, violence, drama, whatever you want can happen. Don’t let grief put you down, take the world by the horns as you shrink down to microscopic size and then are gone.




Thanks to everyone that adds or just reads Tiny Way to Die. Please review and tell me what you’d like to see more of and remember, you have little time, don’t waste it.


NEW!

I've decided to include a new option, now you can have any character from the Harry Potter series be the unlucky shrinking victim. I'm doing this for two reasons, because I want to and I think it'll be fun. What other reasons do I need? Nothing changes except there is this new option to chose from, you can either use an original character or an HP one. Pick anyone you like and make them shrink down until there is nothing to be seen.

Have fun and enjoy this new magical addition to Tiny Way to Die ^_^
